basejump 0.99.0

  • Changelog

Return the First and Last Part of an Object

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/headtail-methods.R
headtail.Rd

Inspired by the base::print() method for DataFrame class objects. Applies to both rows and columns, enabling quick inspection during interactive use.

headtail(x, ...)

# S4 method for atomic
headtail(x, n = 2L)

# S4 method for matrix
headtail(x, n = 2L)

# S4 method for sparseMatrix
headtail(x, n = 2L)

# S4 method for data.frame
headtail(x, n = 2L)

# S4 method for DataFrame
headtail(x, n = 2L)

# S4 method for GRanges
headtail(x, n = 2L)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
headtail(x, n = 2L)

Arguments

x

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
n

scalar integer. Positive integer denoting the number of first and last items to include.

Value

None (invisible NULL).

Methods (by class)

  • atomic: Paste collapse to a string.

  • matrix: Show first and last rows.

  • sparseMatrix: Same method as matrix.

  • data.frame: Same method as matrix.

  • DataFrame: Same method as data.frame.

  • GRanges: Summarize the ranges.

  • SummarizedExperiment: Summarize the primary SummarizedExperiment::assay().

See also

  • utils::head(), utils::tail(), base::cat().

  • getMethod("show", "DataTable").

Examples

data(rse_small, sce_small)

## data.frame ====
headtail(datasets::mtcars)
#>                mpg cyl │ gear carb
#> Mazda RX4       21   6 │    4    4
#> Mazda RX4 Wag   21   6 │    4    4
#> ─                ─   ─ ┼    ─    ─
#> Maserati Bora   15   8 │    5    8
#> Volvo 142E    21.4   4 │    4    2
headtail(dplyr::starwars)
#>             name height │ vehicles starships
#> 1 Luke Skywalker    172 │       <>        <>
#> 2          C-3PO    167 │       <>        <>
#> ─              ─      ─ ┼        ─         ─
#> 3 Captain Phasma   <NA> │       <>        <>
#> 4  Padmé Amidala    165 │       <>        <>

## SummarizedExperiment ====
headtail(rse_small)
#> Object can't be split into quadrants.
#>       sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> gene1       7       4      14      50
#> gene2      24       2       4       1
#> gene3       2       5       1       9
#> gene4     230     135     111      93

## SingleCellExperiment ====
headtail(sce_small)
#>                 cell001 cell002 │ cell999 cell1000
#> ENSG00000000003      82      52 │      48       93
#> ENSG00000000005       0      99 │       0      138
#> ─                     ─       ─ ┼       ─        ─
#> ENSG00000008056     423     305 │     391      487
#> ENSG00000008083     133     101 │     133      168
